It is characterized by its large, flat, leaf-like structures called thallus, which are typically green and capable of photosynthesis. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Pleocnemia pleiotricha reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia. Its simple yet efficient structure allows it to efficiently absorb water and nutrients from its surroundings.
